name: Fédération Internationale des Footballeurs Professionnelles Division Europe
goal:
FIFPro Division Europe is the European branch of FIFPro. FIFPro is a not-for-profit organization. It is the international federation of affiliated professional football players associations. FIFPro is the worldwide representative organization for all professional players; more than 65.000 in total. FIFPro has existed since 1965 and currently has 57 members, 3 candidate members and 11 observers.
FIFPro Division Europe consists of 28 members and 3 candidates (Israel, Kazakhstan and FYROM) and 5 observers (Bosnia and Herzegovina, Georgia, Iceland, Slovakia and Turkey).
interests: Audiovisual and Media, Competition, Culture, Economic and Financial Affairs, Education, Employment and Social Affairs, General and Institutional Affairs, Information Society, Internal Market, Justice and Fundamental Rights, Public Health, Sport, Trade, Youth
euInitiatives:
- EU Work Plan on Sport 2014-2017 including participation in Council Expert Groups including: Match Fixing, Dual Careers, Mega Sport Events, Good Governance in Sport, Economic Impact of Sport, etc.
- European Parliament Intergroup Sport
- European Week of Sport
- Data Protection Regulation
- EU Social Dialogue Committee Professional Football
- Health and safety/Risk assesment tools
